intro: Solanum chondropetalum, commonly known as the rock nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually violet or purple in color. Its berries are toxic and contain alkaloids, making it a plant to be handled with care. Solanum chondropetalum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to thrive in harsh, arid conditions.
